TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LegendCellColumn extends System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartNamedElement implements class System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.IChartMapArea

Docs.summary: Represents a cell column in a legend, which is used to extend the functionality of the default legend.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Any number of cell columns can be placed in any order, which gives you the flexibility to extend the abilities of the default legend entries.
The legend cell columns are only applicable to items that are automatically generated from series or data points.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.ContentAlignment Alignment { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the legend column content alignment.
Docs.value: A value that represents the alignment of the legend cell contents. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used to align text or series symbols within the legend cell column.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the legend cell column.
Docs.value:
A value used to draw the legend cell column background.
The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.BackColor%2A> property of the legend that the legend cell column belongs to. It also overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend.InterlacedRows%2A> property of the legend.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the legend cell column type.
Docs.value: A enumeration value. This value represents the type that will be used to define the legend cell column contents. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property determines the type of content that will be displayed in each individual legend cell column. There are two possible values:
- Text: By default, the #LEGENDTEXT keyword is used to place the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.LegendText%2A> value in each cell column. However, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumn.Text%2A> property to set any keyword(s) that will be replaced by a value of the corresponding series.
- SeriesSymbol: The legend cell will contain a series symbol, such as a rectangle, line, line with marker, or marker, of the same fill color as its corresponding series.

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Font Font { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the font for the legend column text.
Docs.value: A object that specifies the font for the legend column text. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is only applicable when the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumnType> is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumnType.Text>, and a `string` value is defined for the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumn.Text%2A> property. You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumn.Font%2A> property to set font properties of the legend cell column.
If you attempt to change the properties of this <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object at run time, a compilation error will occur. To set font properties at run time, you must create a new <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is only applicable if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumnType> is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumnType.Text>.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Font HeaderFont { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the font used in the legend column header.
Docs.value: A object that specifies the font used in the legend column header. The default value is "Microsoft Sans Serif, 8pt, Bold".

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property can be used to set font properties of the legend cell column header.
If you attempt to change the properties of this <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object at run time, a compilation error will occur. To set font properties at run time, you must create a new <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object.

Docs.value: A value that specifies the color of the legend column header text.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string HeaderText { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text for the legend cell column header.
Docs.value: A value that represents the legend cell column header text. The default value is a zero-length string.

Docs.summary: Gets the legend in which this legend cell column belongs to.
Docs.value: A object that represents the legend in which this legend cell column belongs to.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string MapAreaAttributes { get; set; }

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.KeywordsStringEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the map area attributes of the legend cell column.
Docs.value: A value that represents the attributes of the map area that corresponds to the legend cell column. The default value is a zero-length string.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the margins of the legend cell column.
Docs.value: A object that represents the top, bottom, left, and right values of the legend cell margins. The default values for top, bottom, left and right are "0,0,15,15".

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is measured as a percentage of the legend font size.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int MaximumWidth { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum width of the legend cell column.
Docs.value: An value that represents the maximum width of the legend cell column. The default value is minus one (-1), which means that the maximum width is automatically calculated.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int MinimumWidth { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum width of the legend cell column.
Docs.value: An value that represents the minimum width of the legend cell column. The default value is minus one (-1), which means that the minimum width is automatically calculated.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Name { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the legend cell column.
Docs.value: A value that represents the text name of the legend cell column.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The name of the legend cell must be unique; otherwise an exception will be thrown.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumn.Name%2A> property can be used as the indexer when retrieving a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumn> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumnCollection>.
If you set this property to a zero-length string, an exception will be thrown.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the postback value that can be processed on a event.
Docs.value: A value that represents the postback value that is passed to a event.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Size SeriesSymbolSize { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size of the series symbol displayed in a legend cell column.
Docs.value: A object that represents the size of the series symbol. The default values for the width and height of the symbol are 200 and 70, respectively.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The size of the series symbol is measured as a percentage of the legend font size.
This property is only applicable if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumnType> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumnType.SeriesSymbol>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text of the legend cell column.
Docs.value: A value that represents the text for the legend cell column. The default value is a zero-length string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is only applicable if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumnType> is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumnType.Text>.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ToolTip { get; set; }

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.KeywordsStringEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the tooltip text for the legend cell column.
Docs.value: A value that represents the tooltip for the legend cell column. The default value is a zero-length string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property will have no effect if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.IsMapEnabled%2A> property is set to `false`. The default value is `true`.
**Important** To create an image map in this manner, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.RenderType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object must be set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.RenderType.ImageTag>. It is possible to create an image map when using binary streaming, but another technique must be used.
If the `ToolTip` property is set for both a legend item and a legend cell, the legend cell property has precedence.
This <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumn.ToolTip%2A> property allows you to set special keywords to display different types of chart-related data.
To create image maps that have user-defined coordinates, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.MapAreas%2A> property of the root <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart>object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string Url { get; set; }

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Web.UI.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.KeywordsStringEditor, System.Web.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL target of the legend cell columns automatically generated from a series or data point.
Docs.value: A value that represents the destination URL or anchor point of the chart element. To use an absolute URL start the string expression with either "http://" or "www.". If the string does not start with either of these prefixes it will be treated as a relative URL. The default value is a zero-length string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you set this property, a client-side image map will be automatically created. A map area will also be created with its Href attribute set to the specified anchor or URL.
Setting this property will have no effect if the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.IsMapEnabled%2A> property is set to `false`. The default value is `true`.
Attributes of the map area(s), for example, target=_blank, can be specified by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCell.MapAreaAttributes%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCellColumn.Url%2A> property allows you to set special keywords to display different types of chart-related data.
To create image maps that have user-defined coordinates, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.MapAreas%2A> property of the root <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart>object.
